title: Amazon Lambda Connection
help:
Amazon Lambda Connector

The Amazon Lambda connector allows you to access the Amazon Lambda compute service for running code without provisioning or managing servers.

This connector uses AWS Signature Version 4 for authentication. You must provide valid AWS credentials (Access Key ID and Secret Access Key) along with the AWS region where your Lambda functions are deployed.

Prerequisites: Ensure you have an AWS account with appropriate IAM permissions for Lambda operations.

value.name: connectionName
value.helpTip: A unique name for this Amazon Lambda connection configuration

value.name: region
value.helpTip: The AWS region where your Lambda functions are deployed (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1)

value.name: accessKeyId
value.helpTip: The AWS Access Key ID for authentication. This corresponds to the IAM user or role credentials

value.name: secretAccessKey
value.helpTip: The AWS Secret Access Key for authentication. Keep this secure and do not expose in logs

value.name: blocking
value.helpTip: Enable blocking invocations to Amazon Lambda.
